greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A000217(A001511(n)), where A001511 is one more than the 2-adic valuation of n, and A000217(n) is the n-th triangular number, binomial(n+1, 2).
comment: Row sums of A115363. In general, the row sums of ((1,x) - m(x,x^2))^(-2) are obtained by following the ruler function A001511(n) by the solution of the recurrence a(1)=1, a(n) = n*m^(n-1) + a(n-1), n > 1.
The Stephan formula says this is the Dirichlet convolution of A000012 with A104117. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 07 2011
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16383
formula: Multiplicative with a(2^k) = A000217(k+1), a(p^k) = 1 for odd primes p. - _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 02 2018

O.g.f.: Sum_{k >= 1} k*x^(2^(k-1))/(1 - x^(2^(k-1))). More generally, if f(n) is an arithmetic function and g(n) := Sum_{k = 1..n} f(k), then Sum_{k >= 1} f(k)*x^(2^(k-1))/(1 - x^(2^(k-1))) = Sum_{n >= 1} g(A001511(n))*x^n. This is the case f(n) = n. - _Peter Bala_, Mar 26 2019
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Jan 21 2006
ext: Formula corrected and the name changed by _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 02 2018
